metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the linux-def:selinuxboolean_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the linux-def:selinuxboolean_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

selinuxboolean_test.comment: Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the selinuxboolean_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

selinuxboolean_object.comment: Retrieve an selinuxboolean_item with a name equal to 'allow_console_login'.
selinuxboolean_object.name: allow_console_login

selinuxboolean_object.comment: Retrieve selinuxboolean_items with names that are not equal to 'allow_console_login'.
selinuxboolean_object.name: allow_console_login

selinuxboolean_object.comment: Retrieve selinuxboolean_items with names that match the regular expression '^allow[_a-z]+$'.
selinuxboolean_object.name: ^allow[_a-z]+$

selinuxboolean_state.comment: This state represents an selinuxboolean_item that has a name equal to 'allow_console_login', a current_status that is equal to either '0' or '1', and a pending_status that is not equal to either 'true' or 'false'.
selinuxboolean_state.name: allow_console_login

selinuxboolean_state.comment: This state represents selinuxboolean_items that have a name not equal to 'allow_console_login', a current_status that is equal to either '0' or '1', and a pending_status that is not equal to either 'true' or 'false'.
selinuxboolean_state.name: allow_console_login

selinuxboolean_state.comment: This state represents selinuxboolean_items that have a name that matches the regular expression '^allow[_a-z]+$', a current_status that is equal to either '0' or '1', and a pending_status that is not equal to either 'true' or 'false'.
selinuxboolean_state.name: ^allow[_a-z]+$

constant_variable.comment: This variable represents the numeric representations of the boolean values for true and false.
This variable represents the textual representations of the boolean values for true and false.
